result.execSummary:
This case has not been concluded. Unless a judgment of conviction is entered, the defendant is presumed innocent of all charges.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.
result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Leonard Paul Johnson

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Leonard Paul Johnson in court.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask in court for Leonard Paul Johnson.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz in court for State of Wisconsin. 
Final pre-trial held. Case remains in trial posture. Defense counsel requests to be heard as to bail on the day of trial. Case remains calendared for a jury trial on 11/14/22 at 8:30 am in Branch 29.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 10-25-2022, filed.
State's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
State's Witness List, received and filed.
Pretrial Services Status Report 10-17-2022, filed.
Defendant's Requested Jury Instructions, received and filed.
Defendant's Witness List, received and filed
Defendant's Motions in Limine, received and filed.
Pretrial Services Status Report 9-30-2022, filed.

Defendant Leonard Paul Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Leonard Paul Johnson.  Attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for State of Wisconsin. 
Case set for a preliminary hearing. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing.  Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed.  Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial. Defense acknowledges receipt of the Information, waives reading and enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of his client. Defense requests Final Pretrial and Jury Trial dates. Any witness lists, special jury instructions, and motion in limine to be filed 48 hours before the final pretrial date. Court orders case adjourned for final pretrial and jury trial in Branch 29.
Final pre-trial scheduled for October 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Jury trial scheduled for November 14, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 9-26-2022, filed.

Defendant Leonard Paul Johnson appeared by video.  Attorney Joseph Thomas Domask appeared by video for Leonard Paul Johnson.  Prosecuting attorney Katie Bakunowicz appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin. Case in court for State v Lee hearing. Attorney Domask was recently retained and provides an update to the court. Court finds cause to adjourn preliminary hearing. Case adjourned to Br 29.
Preliminary hearing scheduled for September 27, 2022 at 02:00 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8-23-2022, filed.

Defendant Leonard Paul Johnson in court.  Ryan Jay Michaels appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for Preliminary Hearing. Matter held via Zoom video conference. The PD's Office needs additional time to appoint counsel. State counsel requests a State V Lee hearing.  Court grants request and adjourns matter  FOR CAUSE to Br 29.  Hearing scheduled for August 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7-25-2022, filed.

Defendant Leonard Paul Johnson in court.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Case in court for preliminary hearing. States witness is not present.  OPD needs additional time to appoint an attorney. State requests the matter be set for a State V. Lee hearing in the trial court; denied. Court finds good CAUSE to adjourn preliminary hearing.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 7-01-2022; filed.

22RM031239  Actual Date Bond Posted with *sheriffs
06-23-2022

Court ordered no contact with C.M.Y. (12/9/94), M.J (9/5/2020) and M.J (12/30/2021)
No Contact/No Weapons Order, signed and filed.
Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for SUPERVISION Level 5.  The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Leonard Paul Johnson in court with attorney Sylvan Jaspen.  Defendant Leonard Paul Johnson in custody.  Thomas Hasle appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Kiefer Branch 29.  Defense enters a plea of NOT GUILTY as to misdemeanor counts 2, 3 and 4.  Court advised defendant that due to nature of offense in Count 1 a sample of your DNA is required.  If the sheriff's department hasn't already obtained a sample I order them to do so. There are circumstances that you can request the sample to be expunged from the data base pursuant to statute 165.77(4).  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold the defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Case is adjourned for preliminary hearing in Branch PE. 
 This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for July 5, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
